post.summary:
Create a new cluster from an existing backup
Required permissions (both):
- restore:backups
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the backup (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: Name of the new cluster

get.summary:
Lists all clusters in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: cloudProviderId
parameters.description:
Optional filter specifying the cloud provider where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the provider IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviders` method.
If omitted, all clusters for the specified account are returned, including those hosted in hybrid cloud environments.

parameters.name: cloudProviderRegionId
parameters.description:
Optional filter specifying the cloud provider region where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the region IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviderRegions` method.
If this field is set, the `cloud_provider_id` is required to set as well (and it should match).
For hybrid this should be the hybrid cloud environment ID.

get.summary:
Suggests a unique and human-friendly name for a new cluster in the specified account.
This can be used by clients to pre-fill the name field when creating a new cluster.
Required permissions:
- None (authenticated only)

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

get.summary:
Gets a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

delete.summary:
Deletes a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- delete:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

parameters.name: deleteBackups
parameters.description: If set, the backups of this cluster will be deleted as well.

post.summary:
Restarts a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Suspends a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Unsuspends a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

get.summary:
Lists all Qdrant releases in the account identified by the given ID.
Optionally a cluster ID can be provided, the list will return the update options for that cluster only.
Required permissions:
- read:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This cluster should be part of the provided account.
This is an optional field.

get.summary:
Gets a Qdrant release by version in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- read:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
The version of the Qdrant release.
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Creates a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:clusters

parameters.name: cluster.accountId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

put.summary:
Updates a cluster in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:clusters

parameters.name: cluster.accountId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: cluster.id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

name.title:
Name of the cluster.
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was deleted (or is started to be deleting).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteCluster is called.

cloudProviderId.description:
Cloud provider where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the provider IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviders` method.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

cloudProviderRegionId.description:
Cloud provider region where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the region IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviderRegions` method.
For hybrid this should be the hybrid cloud environment ID.
This is a required field.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

labels.title:
List of labels for a cluster. These labels are used in the cloud ui and billing reports.
This is an optional field

configuration.description: Current configuration details of the cluster.

state.description:
Current state of the cluster (available after the cluster has been created).
All fields inside `state` are read-only.

ClusterServiceCreateClusterBody.title: CreateClusterRequest is the request for the CreateCluster function

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

name.title:
Name of the cluster.
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was deleted (or is started to be deleting).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteCluster is called.

cloudProviderId.description:
Cloud provider where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the provider IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviders` method.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

cloudProviderRegionId.description:
Cloud provider region where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the region IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviderRegions` method.
For hybrid this should be the hybrid cloud environment ID.
This is a required field.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

labels.title:
List of labels for a cluster. These labels are used in the cloud ui and billing reports.
This is an optional field

configuration.description: Current configuration details of the cluster.

state.description:
Current state of the cluster (available after the cluster has been created).
All fields inside `state` are read-only.

ClusterServiceUpdateClusterBody.title: UpdateClusterRequest is the request for the UpdateCluster function

key.description: The key to match against the key of a node label.

operator.description:
The operator represents a key's relationship to the value.
The default is TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EXISTS.

value.description: The value to match against the value of a node label.

effect.description:
The effect indicates the taint effect to match.
The default is TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_SCHEDULE.

tolerationSeconds.description: The toleration seconds indicates the duration to tolerate the taint.

cloudclusterv1Toleration.description: The Toleration message represents a toleration object for Kubernetes.

v1AdditionalResources.title: AdditionalResources contains the information about additional resources

id.description:
Unique identifier for the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

accountId.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

name.title:
Name of the cluster.
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster was deleted (or is started to be deleting).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteCluster is called.

cloudProviderId.description:
Cloud provider where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the provider IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviders` method.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

cloudProviderRegionId.description:
Cloud provider region where the cluster is hosted.
Must match one of the region IDs returned by the `qdrant.cloud.platform.v1.PlatformService.ListCloudProviderRegions` method.
For hybrid this should be the hybrid cloud environment ID.
This is a required field.
After creation, this field cannot be changed.

labels.title:
List of labels for a cluster. These labels are used in the cloud ui and billing reports.
This is an optional field

configuration.description: Current configuration details of the cluster.

state.description:
Current state of the cluster (available after the cluster has been created).
All fields inside `state` are read-only.

v1Cluster.description: A Cluster represents one cluster of a Qdrant database.

lastModifiedAt.description:
Timestamp when the cluster configuration was last updated.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a cluster is created.

numberOfNodes.description:
The number of nodes in a cluster.
This should be a number 1...20 [both included].
This is a required field.

version.description:
Version of the cluster software.
If omitted the latest version will be used and filled out during create.
Use ListReleases() to determine which versions are allowed to be used.
See upgrade guidelines for more info.

packageId.description:
The package identifier used to configure the resources of the cluster. Use `qdrant.cloud.booking.v1.BookingService.ListPackages` to select one.
This is a required field.

additionalResources.description:
The additional resources on top of the selected package.
This is an optional field, if not specified all additional resources are 0.

databaseConfiguration.description:
Configuration to setup a qdrant database.
This is an optional field.

nodeSelector.title:
The node selector for this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

tolerations.title:
List of tolerations for this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

annotations.title:
List of annotations for this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

allowedIpSourceRanges.description:
List of allowed IP source ranges for this cluster.
Field is used for both managed cloud and hybrid cloud and clusters. This is an optional field
The CIDRs supports IPv4 only.

serviceType.description:
The type of service to use for this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field, default is Cluster IP.

serviceAnnotations.title:
List of annotations applied to the service of this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

podLabels.title:
List of labels applied to the pods of this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

reservedCpuPercentage.title:
The percentage of CPU resources reserved for system components
This is an optional field, default is 20%.
Number between 1..80 (both included)

reservedMemoryPercentage.title:
The percentage of RAM resources reserved for system components
This is an optional field, default is 20%.
Number between 1..80 (both included)

gpuType.title:
The gpu type that should be used for the database
This is an optional field, default is No configured GPU

restartPolicy.title:
The restart policy for the database
This is an optional field, default is Automatic

rebalanceStrategy.title:
The automatic shard rebalancing strategy for the database
This is an optional field, default is none

topologySpreadConstraints.title:
List of topologySpreadConstraints for this cluster in a hybrid cloud environment.
It is ignored for managed cloud clusters. This is an optional field

clusterStorageConfiguration.title: Storage IOPS and Throughput configuration, defaults to BASE storage configuration

v1ClusterConfiguration.description: A ClusterConfiguration represents the configuration of a cluster.

v1ClusterConfigurationGpuType.description:
ClusterConfigurationGpuType defines GPU types available for clusters.

 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_GPU_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No GPU is configured.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_GPU_TYPE_NVIDIA: Use an NVIDIA GPU.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_GPU_TYPE_AMD: Use an AMD GPU.

v1ClusterConfigurationRebalanceStrategy.description:
ClusterConfigurationRebalanceStrategy defines shard rebalancing strategies.

 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_REBALANCE_STRATEGY_UNSPECIFIED: No rebalancing strategy is configured.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_REBALANCE_STRATEGY_BY_COUNT: Rebalance shards by count.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_REBALANCE_STRATEGY_BY_SIZE: Rebalance shards by size.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_REBALANCE_STRATEGY_BY_COUNT_AND_SIZE: Rebalance shards by both count and size.

v1ClusterConfigurationRestartPolicy.description:
ClusterConfigurationRestartPolicy defines restart strategies for the cluster's database.

 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_RESTART_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED: Restart policy is unspecified.
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_RESTART_POLICY_ROLLING: Rolling restart policy (one by one).
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_RESTART_POLICY_PARALLEL: Parallel restart policy (restart all at once).
 - CLUSTER_CONFIGURATION_RESTART_POLICY_AUTOMATIC: Automatic restart policy.

url.title: URL to access the qdrant cluster (aka database) without port

restPort.title: The port to use for HTTP REST calls (6333)

grpcPort.title: The port to use for gRPC calls (6334)

v1ClusterEndpoint.description:
Endpoint information to access the qdrant cluster (aka database) or a specific node in the cluster.
All fields in this message are a read-only field.

name.description: Name specifies the name of the node.

startedAt.description: StartedAt specifies the time when the node started.

version.description: Version specifies the version of Qdrant running on the node.

v1ClusterNodeInfo.description:
ClusterNodeInfo represents a node in a cluster.
All fields in this message are read-only.

base.description:
Base resources that are part of the standard allocation for the cluster per node.
This includes default CPU, memory, storage, etc.

complimentary.description:
Complimentary resources provided to the cluster at no additional cost.
This might include complimentary network bandwidth, credits, etc.

additional.description:
Additional resources allocated to the cluster.
This could include additional storage, compute power, etc.

reserved.description: The reserved is the amount used by the system, which cannot be used by the database itself.

available.title: The available is the total (base+complimentary+additional) - reserved

v1ClusterNodeResources.description: ClusterNodeResources represents the allocation of various resources for a cluster per node.

v1ClusterNodeResourcesSummary.description: ClusterNodeResourcesSummary represents the resources used in this cluster per node.

v1ClusterNodeState.description:
ClusterNodeState represents the state of a cluster node.

 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: The state is unspecified.
 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_STARTING: The node is starting.
 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_HEALTHY: The node is healthy.
 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_UNHEALTHY: The node is unhealthy.
 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_SUSPENDED: The node is suspended.
 - CLUSTER_NODE_STATE_RECOVERING: The node is started but still needs to do some operations to recover.

v1ClusterPhase.description:
Defines the operational or transitional state of the Qdrant cluster.

 - CLUSTER_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: The phase is unknown or not specified. Should not normally be used.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_CREATING: The cluster is currently being created.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_FAILED_TO_CREATE: The cluster creation process failed.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_UPDATING: The cluster configuration is being updated.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_FAILED_TO_UPDATE: The cluster update process failed.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_SCALING: The cluster is undergoing scaling (up or down).
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_UPGRADING: The Qdrant version in the cluster is being upgraded.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_SUSPENDING: The cluster is in the process of being suspended.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_SUSPENDED: The cluster is currently suspended (inactive).
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_FAILED_TO_SUSPEND: The cluster suspension process failed.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_RESUMING: The cluster is resuming from a suspended state.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_FAILED_TO_RESUME: The cluster resumption process failed.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_HEALTHY: The cluster is operational and healthy.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_NOT_READY: The cluster is operational but not all components are ready or healthy.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_RECOVERY_MODE: The cluster is in recovery mode, potentially after a failure.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_MANUAL_MAINTENANCE: The cluster is under manual maintenance.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_FAILED_TO_SYNC: There was an error syncing the cluster in the cloud provider region.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_NOT_FOUND: The cluster was expected but not found in the cloud provider region.
 - CLUSTER_PHASE_DELETING: The cluster is being deleted.

status.description: The current scalability status of the cluster.

reason.description:
Optional human-readable reason providing more context about the scalability status.
When a cluster is not scalable, this field explains why.

v1ClusterScalabilityStatus.description:
ClusterScalabilityStatus defines the scalability states of a cluster.

 - CLUSTER_SCALABILITY_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Scalability status is unspecified.
 - CLUSTER_SCALABILITY_STATUS_NOT_SCALABLE: The cluster is not scalable.
 - CLUSTER_SCALABILITY_STATUS_SCALABLE: The cluster supports scaling operations.

v1ClusterServiceType.description:
- CLUSTER_SERVICE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Service type is unspecified.
 - CLUSTER_SERVICE_TYPE_CLUSTER_IP: Use a service configured with type ClusterIP.
 - CLUSTER_SERVICE_TYPE_NODE_PORT: Use a service configured with type NodePort.
 - CLUSTER_SERVICE_TYPE_LOAD_BALANCER: Use a service configured with type LoadBalancer.
v1ClusterServiceType.title:
ClusterServiceType defines the type of service to use for the cluster.
See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubernetes-api/service-resources/service-v1/#ServiceSpec

nodesUp.description: Number of cluster nodes that are up and running.

restartedAt.description: The date and time when the cluster was restarted.

reason.description: Reason for the current phase of the cluster.

endpoint.description: Endpoint information to access the qdrant cluster (aka database).

resources.title:
The resources used by the cluster per node.
For the complete cluster you have to multiply by cluster.configuration.number_of_nodes

scalabilityInfo.description: Whether the cluster can be scaled up or down.

nodes.description: List of nodes in the cluster.

v1ClusterState.description:
ClusterState represents the current state of a cluster
All fields in this message are read-only.

v1ClusterStorageConfiguration.title: ClusterStorageConfiguration defines Storage IOPS and Throughput configuration

v1ClusterStorageConfigurationStorageTier.description:
- CLUSTER_STORAGE_CONFIGURATION_STORAGE_TIER_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No storage tier type is configured, same as BASE
 - CLUSTER_STORAGE_CONFIGURATION_STORAGE_TIER_TYPE_BASE: Base pre-configured type
 - CLUSTER_STORAGE_CONFIGURATION_STORAGE_TIER_TYPE_BALANCED: Mid tier pre-configured type
 - CLUSTER_STORAGE_CONFIGURATION_STORAGE_TIER_TYPE_PERFORMANCE: Most performant pre-configured type
 - CLUSTER_STORAGE_CONFIGURATION_STORAGE_TIER_TYPE_CUSTOM: IOPS and Throughput values are to be configured by user
v1ClusterStorageConfigurationStorageTier.title: ClusterStorageTierConfigurationStorageTierType defines type of storage tier

v1CreateClusterFromBackupResponse.description: CreateClusterFromBackupResponse is the response for the CreateCluster function.

v1CreateClusterResponse.title: CreateClusterResponse is the response from the CreateCluster function

collection.description:
The default Qdrant database collection configuration.
This setting is for both managed and hybrid cloud clusters, see sub-messages for more details.
This is an optional field.

storage.description:
The default Qdrant database storage configuration.
This setting is for both managed and hybrid cloud clusters.
This is an optional field.

service.title:
The Qdrant database service configuration
This setting is for both managed and hybrid cloud clusters, see sub-messages for more details.
This is an optional field

logLevel.description:
The log level for the database.
Qdrant is written in Rust and is using: https://docs.rs/log/latest/log/enum.LevelFilter.html
This setting is for hybrid cloud clusters only, it is ignored for managed cloud clusters.
This is an optional field, default is Info.

tls.description:
The Qdrant database TLS configuration.
This setting is for hybrid cloud clusters only, it is ignored for managed cloud clusters.
This is an optional field, if not set an unsecure connection is provided.

inference.title:
The Qdrant database inference configuration.
This setting is for managed cloud clusters only, it is ignored for hybrid cloud clusters.
This is an optional field, if unset, the database is not configured for cloud inferencing

v1DatabaseConfiguration.description:
Configuration to setup a Qdrant database.
The settings apply to managed and/or hybrid cloud, see documentation on each message for more details.

replicationFactor.title:
Number of replicas of each shard that network tries to maintain
This is an optional, the default is 1

writeConsistencyFactor.title:
How many replicas should apply the operation for us to consider it successful
This is an optional, the default is 1

vectors.description:
The default parameters for vectors.
This is an implicit optional field, see DatabaseConfigurationCollectionVectors for defaults.

v1DatabaseConfigurationCollection.title: The default Qdrant database collection configuration

onDisk.description:
If set, this will create a collection with all vectors immediately stored in memmap storage.
This is the recommended way, in case your Qdrant instance operates with fast disks and you are working with large collections.
For more info see: https://qdrant.tech/documentation/concepts/storage/#configuring-memmap-storage
This is an optional field, the default value will be true.

v1DatabaseConfigurationCollectionVectors.title: The default Qdrant database collection vectors configuration

enabled.title: If true, the database is configured to use cloud inferencing

v1DatabaseConfigurationLogLevel.description:
- DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_TRACE: Trace log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG: Debug log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_INFO: Info log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_WARN: Warn log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR: Error log level.
 - DATABASE_CONFIGURATION_LOG_LEVEL_OFF: Off log level.
v1DatabaseConfigurationLogLevel.title:
DatabaseConfigurationLogLevel defines the supported logging levels for the
Qdrant database. See: https://docs.rs/log/latest/log/enum.LevelFilter.html

apiKey.title:
Set an api-key.
This setting is for hybrid cloud clusters only, for managed cloud please use qdrant.cloud.cluster.auth.[v1|v2].DatabaseApiKeyService to configure keys.
If set, all requests must include a header with the api-key.
example header: `api-key: <API-KEY>`

readOnlyApiKey.title:
Set an api-key for read-only operations.
This setting is for hybrid cloud clusters only, for managed cloud please use qdrant.cloud.cluster.auth.[v1|v2].DatabaseApiKeyService to configure keys.
If set, all requests must include a header with the api-key.
example header: `api-key: <API-KEY>`

jwtRbac.description:
Enable JWT Role Based Access Control (RBAC).
This setting is for both managed and hybrid cloud clusters.
For managed cloud clusters, this defaults to enabled and cannot be explicitly disabled.
For hybrid cloud clusters, the value is applied as provided.
If enabled, you can generate JWT tokens with fine-grained rules for access control.
Use generated token instead of API key.

enableTls.description:
Enable HTTPS for the REST and gRPC API
This setting is for hybrid cloud clusters only, for managed cloud clusters the platform controls it (and clients need to use a secure connection).

performance.title: The performance related Qdrant database storage configuration

optimizerCpuBudget.description:
CPU budget, how many CPUs (threads) to allocate for an optimization job.
If 0 - auto selection, keep 1 or more CPUs unallocated depending on CPU size
If negative - subtract this number of CPUs from the available CPUs.
If positive - use this exact number of CPUs.

asyncScorer.title:
Enable async scorer which uses io_uring when rescoring.
Only supported on Linux, must be enabled in your kernel.
See: https://qdrant.tech/articles/io_uring/#and-what-about-qdrant

v1DatabaseConfigurationStoragePerformanc.title: The performance related Qdrant database storage configuration

cert.title: Secret to use for the certificate

key.title: Secret to use for the private key

v1DatabaseConfigurationTls.title: DatabaseConfigurationTls contains the information to setup a TLS connection to the database endpoint

v1DeleteClusterResponse.title: DeleteClusterResponse is the response from the DeleteCluster function

v1GetClusterResponse.title: GetClusterResponse is the response from the GetCluster function

v1GetQdrantReleaseResponse.title: GetQdrantReleaseResponse is the response from the GetQdrantRelease function

key.title: The key part of a key-value pair

value.title: The value part of a key-value pair

v1KeyValue.description:
KeyValue is a key-value tuple (used in e.g. node selectors / annotations)
The message represents an object for Kubernetes.

matchLabels.title:
matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels
map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the
operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.
+optional

matchExpressions.title:
matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
+optional

v1LabelSelector.title:
A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and
matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null
label selector matches no objects.
+structType=atomic

key.title:
key is the label key that the selector applies to.
+patchMergeKey=key
+patchStrategy=merge

operator.description:
operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.
Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.title:
values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.
+optional

v1LabelSelectorRequirement.description:
A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

items.title: The actual clusters in this list

v1ListClustersResponse.title: ListClustersResponse is the response from the ListClusters function

items.title:
The actual Qdrant releases in this list, ordered by the version field in ascending semantic version order.
For example: v1.12.6, v1.13.6, v1.14.1, v1.15.4

v1ListQdrantReleasesResponse.title: ListQdrantReleasesResponse is the response from the ListQdrantReleases function

default.description:
Flag to indicate if this is the default release
There can be at most a single item in the list that have this property set.

remarks.title: Additional message regarding this release that might be useful to the client"

endOfLife.title: True, if the release version is end of life and not supported anymore

unavailable.title: True, if the release is not available for the cluster creation or updates

v1QdrantRelease.title: QdrantRelease represent a single Qdrant release

v1RestartClusterResponse.title: RestartClusterResponse is the response from the RestartCluster function

name.title:
The name of the secret (in the same namespace as the QdrantCluster CRD instance)
This is a required field

key.title:
The key inside the secret
This is a required field

v1SecretKeyRef.title: SecretKeyRef is a reference to a Kubernetes secret name and the key inside the secret

name.description: The suggested name for a new cluster.

v1SuggestClusterNameResponse.title: SuggestClusterNameResponse is the response from the SuggestClusterName function

v1SuspendClusterResponse.title: SuspendClusterResponse is the response from the SuspendCluster function

v1TolerationEffect.description:
- TOLERATION_EFFECT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_SCHEDULE: NoSchedule taint effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_PREFER_NO_SCHEDULE: PreferNoSchedule taint effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_EXECUTE: NoExecute taint effect.
v1TolerationEffect.title:
TolerationEffect represents the effects a taint has on pod scheduling and eviction.
See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

v1TolerationOperator.description:
- TOLERATION_OPERATOR_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified operator.
 - TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EXISTS: The operator means the key exists.
 - TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EQUAL: The operator means the key equals the given value.
v1TolerationOperator.title:
TolerationOperator defines the valid operators for tolerations.
See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

maxSkew.description:
MaxSkew describes the degree to which pods may be unevenly distributed.
When `whenUnsatisfiable=DoNotSchedule`, it is the maximum permitted difference
between the number of matching pods in the target topology and the global minimum.
For example, in a 3-zone cluster, MaxSkew is set to 1, and pods with the same
labelSelector spread as 1/1/0:
+-------+-------+-------+
| zone1 | zone2 | zone3 |
+-------+-------+-------+
|   P   |   P   |       |
+-------+-------+-------+
- if MaxSkew is 1, incoming pod can only be scheduled to zone3 to become 1/1/1;
scheduling it onto zone1(zone2) would make the ActualSkew(2-0) on zone1(zone2)
violate MaxSkew(1).
- if MaxSkew is 2, incoming pod can be scheduled onto any zone.
When `whenUnsatisfiable=ScheduleAnyway`, it is used to give higher precedence
to topologies that satisfy it.
It's a required field. Default value is 1 and 0 is not allowed.

topologyKey.description:
TopologyKey is the key of node labels. Nodes that have a label with this key
and identical values are considered to be in the same topology.
We consider each <key, value> as a "bucket", and try to put balanced number
of pods into each bucket.
It's a required field.

whenUnsatisfiable.description:
WhenUnsatisfiable indicates how to deal with a pod if it doesn't satisfy
the spread constraint.
- DoNotSchedule (default) tells the scheduler not to schedule it.
- ScheduleAnyway tells the scheduler to schedule the pod in any location,
  but giving higher precedence to topologies that would help reduce the
  skew.
A constraint is considered "Unsatisfiable" for an incoming pod
if and only if every possible node assignment for that pod would violate
"MaxSkew" on some topology.
For example, in a 3-zone cluster, MaxSkew is set to 1, and pods with the same
labelSelector spread as 3/1/1:
+-------+-------+-------+
| zone1 | zone2 | zone3 |
+-------+-------+-------+
| P P P |   P   |   P   |
+-------+-------+-------+
If WhenUnsatisfiable is set to DoNotSchedule, incoming pod can only be scheduled
to zone2(zone3) to become 3/2/1(3/1/2) as ActualSkew(2-1) on zone2(zone3) satisfies
MaxSkew(1). In other words, the cluster can still be imbalanced, but scheduler
won't make it *more* imbalanced.
It's a required field.

labelSelector.title:
LabelSelector is used to find matching pods.
Pods that match this label selector are counted to determine the number of pods
in their corresponding topology domain.
+optional

v1TopologySpreadConstraint.description: TopologySpreadConstraint specifies how to spread matching pods among the given topology.

v1UnsuspendClusterResponse.title: UnsuspendClusterResponse is the response from the UnsuspendCluster function

v1UpdateClusterResponse.title: UpdateClusterResponse is the response from the UpdateCluster function
